intro: Echinolobium nitidum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of morning glories. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through seeds make it both a useful ornamental plant and a potential weed.
